name: Arceus
description:
Arceus (Japanese: アルセウス Arceus) is the god of the Pokémon world and the creator of everything in the Pokémon series of video games, introduced in the Generation IV games (Pokémon Diamond/Pearl) with National Pokédex number 493. It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world. Arceus is also the titular Pokémon of Game Freak's open-world Pokémon game, Pokémon Legends: Arceus.

This piece was created by Pokémon in r/place, and was allied with its surrounding friends, including the letters H and A, as well as the Pachirisu OC to the side.
